website_summaries.verdict: The iBobber is a far less expensive option than a standalone underwater device with sonar readings.
pros: Works in water depth up to 135 feet
Hook it to your fishing line and lure for accurate results
cons: App doesn’t have quite the power of other fish finder software

customer_reviews.title: IBobber = fish
customer_reviews.text: Love the iBobber. Great while drifting to show the fish from my kayak! Just be sure to buy a protective cover for your phone! Worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Sandeel

customer_reviews.title: Great addition your fishing arsenal!
customer_reviews.text: Works well from what little I’ve used in this off-season. Really helpful identifying the structure beneath the water surface so I can make good decisions on what tackle to use. The compact size makes it easy to fit in my gear box. Only negative worth noting was getting the firmware to update took several tries to get it to work. Not sure what the issue was, but the product FAQs were really lacking in the firmware update troubleshooting area. Love the device overall and highly recommend it to my fellow anglers!
customer_reviews.author: slugoo

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy it, does not work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The worst 85$ I've spent in my life. It disconnects after it gets past 10 feet and will not connect again until it's back in range of 10 feet. That's 90 feet shorter than advertised what a load of sh*$
customer_reviews.author: john cunningham

customer_reviews.title: This thing is junk, do your self a favor dont buy it
customer_reviews.text: This thing charges nice, has a little dock with legs. Has good amount of weight at 1.7oz. Here's the big negative ifu cast more than 15 feet the bobber loses signal the depth graphing sux, it says there fish ever 4 feet, it tells you your reeling when your not, all around it's the biggest waste of my money in 2018, the return is so stupid it's not even worth my time
customer_reviews.author: squirrel

customer_reviews.title: I returned it
customer_reviews.text: Not a lot to say here. I used 3 times in fairly placid water. It did not accurately show the depth of the water and has a hard time telling the difference between a fish, a rock or a log. The most annoying thing was the software on my phone. I have a new S10 Android phone and even when I was sure I had completely exited the software it would continue to send error messages about the software stopping unexpectedly. A couple of times it locked up the phone when the error message appeared. I had to uninstall the software to get it to stop. Back to the old fashioned way of looking for those fish.
customer_reviews.author: David Joiner

customer_reviews.title: Disapointment
customer_reviews.text: Was a great idea was really looking forward to getting the product and trying it out. Was excited when I got it went fishing after charging it for 3 hours was really excited to use it and then very disappointed once i used it. Didn't keep a charge kept reading rocks as fish and it was just overall a big disappointment and waste of money kept looseing signal . Really disappointed in this product. I would not recommend to anyone else CAN'T DESCRIBE HOW DISAPOINTED I AM. Wish it wouldhave worked as decirbe would have been awsome but now I basically have a bobber
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: I see fish
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement, the first one had a bad transducer, I emailed the people at RealSonar and the said to return it to Amazon. Amazon stepped up and two days later I had my replacement and am now very happy with it. It’s cool watching fish swim by and now I can see how the fish population is doing in my pond.
customer_reviews.author: William Bone

customer_reviews.title: Login screen renders app and ibobber useless
customer_reviews.text: I own this ibobber and was on a lake outside of cell service. I went to use the app and it asked me to log in! No cell signal, no log in, rendered useless. Who was the genius that came up with the idea of a log in screen before you can use your ibobber? I don't know if that is for everytime or what but what a stupid waste of time even if there is cell service and like I experienced, made the unit useless for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sage Brush

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: I ignored the vast number of negative reviews on this and thought my experience would be different--I was wrong. This is just worthless. Connectivity is really limited. I cast it out about 70 feet and no signal. Reeled in, reconnected, cast out to 50 feet, no signal. This was on a small pond in dead calm wind, water was glass and I couldn't get a read. If it was sitting still in the water right off the dock it would read, but I can see the bottom at this depth. Don't buy one--it sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Knuckles

customer_reviews.title: Priceless for bank anglers
customer_reviews.text: Setting up was surprisingly a breeze, instructions were simple to use even for a novice user of electronics. Mapping by bank kept us moving along the waters edge until fish were present. This cut the time in half since we didn't have to fish for +15-20 min. Before moving to different area. This also gave us the ability to setup camp where the fish were biting which made the entire experience more convenient. We now have motivation to complete repairs on a unusable boat we bought 5 months ago because we can only imagine how using this ibobber in conjunction with the boats fish finder will be! Ray Roberts lake, Valley View, Texas
customer_reviews.author: MOJORISING

customer_reviews.title: All in the IBobber has been convenient and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Had for a year and a half now and not had an issue yet. Syncs to the phone quickly and gives pretty reliable data. I’ve used it mostly to check out the seabed for depth and gradients and has been great in that regard. Price is solid for what it is and the app is updated pretty regularly. My only complaint is the battery life which for me is a couple hours and the charging base which isn’t easy especially for trips that last a couple days. All in the iBobber has been reliable and easy to use and if/when it ever does break I’ll definitely be getting another.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew F.

customer_reviews.title: not too bad
customer_reviews.text: I cant give this 5 stars because of one small tiny problem- there is no safe proof if it gets stuck in the middle of the river, lake, or pond. Good luck trying to hunt that thing down. We just waited for HOURS until it washed to shore. almost wish there was a remote control for it...
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Strickert

customer_reviews.title: This is a great option for someone fishing from small watercraft or ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great option for someone fishing from small watercraft or from the bank. It works well in lakes and in larger "holes" in streams. The readings seem to be accurate. I like it because it assures me that there are fish in the water I am fishing. The only negative is that my phone is difficult to see in direct sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: Bill on the Mason-Dixon Line

customer_reviews.title: Bad fisherman aside, this makes my no catch days all the more frustrating.
customer_reviews.text: Since day one this device has been a headache that I wished I had returned. Setup - very easy, no complaints. Use - the device constantly displays a low signal/bobber out of water warning when its in the water and 3 feet in front of me. 75% of the time it’s in this unusable state. Accuracy - very suspect. Once while kayaking it said I was in 20 feet of water when I was clearly in 5. Water temp, when not fluctuating wildly, appears accurate. Those two issues cause me to seriously question if the fish it’s displaying are “real”. If this item is defective, cool. I hope they offer a swap. If it’s not, then buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Lacroix

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: This is more a very expensive toy that an actual fish finder. When I bought this I was very excited as I going on a fishing tip to a new place I've never fished before and wanted to improve my odds. as it turns out nothing that is listed on the description this item does really happens, if I casting this anywhere farther than 15 feet it would loose connection with my phone. I would get reading depths of 7 feet permanently even if actual depth was 3 feet, and it showed fish where I could clearly see there were none. Do not buy its a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: J. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I use it mostly when bank fishing or from the kayak. I don't like to carry an extra pole just for the iBobber, so I have it tied to a good amount of 30lb mono wrapped on an old kite handle so I can toss it and reel it in as needed. PLEASE NOTE: It states in the description and in the manual that it doesn't work in shallow water. You know you are too shallow if it pings a ton of fish in 7ft of water when you are clearly in shallower areas. If you use it enough you figure it out really quick and toss it to a deeper spot.
customer_reviews.author: OhDumb

customer_reviews.title: Don't be to
customer_reviews.text: I like what it says it can do. I like the easy use. I like how I can take it anywhere. It seems to try and show that it moving over the water when i do a drop shot. That makes me think that there is a problem. No quick moving water with no wind. It show all kinds of vegetation and fish. I don't get that. I also believ 100ft from you really isn't that far. Overall. At least I can use it to find deep spots. I was on my boat dragging it along at low speeds and it says it's out of the water.
customer_reviews.author: Aman Cox

customer_reviews.title: Please don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I should've listened to most of the reviewers and not purchased this thing. Unfortunately covid delayed my ability to return this poorly crafted item before the return deadline. Despite what the directions say, the initial set up is just a pipe dream for most as I could not get the bobber to stay connected for more than one second. I tried over the course of several days but still the same results. I had others try to also start from scratch and redo the entire process but they all failed to get the bobber to work. Listen like i should have and skip this one.
customer_reviews.author: A. Y.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FISHING TOOL
customer_reviews.text: The iBobber is the most accurate portable device I have used! I was curious and did my own research how accurate the iBobber is! Of the 12 “fishing spots” I thoroughly checked with dive gear and modified tape measures, ALL 12 were the exact depth the iBobber showed on the screen. I would recommend the iBobber to anyone for the easy operation and functionality!
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money...JUNK.
customer_reviews.text: The concept is good but the execution is poor. My coworker and I both purchased the iBobber. When we used the mapping app on his, it showed the depth backwards on the screen. In other words it showed the water getting deeper closer to shore and shallower the further away. Mine has terrible reception and I constantly had to re-pair it. Even when it was close the reception constantly went in and out...but mostly out. I tried the light at night but it goes out if you turn on the sonar. Honestly it is a piece of junk. I do not recommend that you buy It. It is just a novelty...JUNK.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Runs all day, no problem
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Valuable tool to pinpoint fish while anchored on bars and drop offs. I use all day on one charge easily.
customer_reviews.author: Russell P. Blazer

customer_reviews.title: This comes in handy when you're fishing from the bank or a kayak.
customer_reviews.text: The Bluetooth range on the iBobber is not as great as the manufacturer claims it is but for the price you get what you pay for. I really enjoy using it whenever I fish off the bank or if I happen to be out fishing from my kayak. It’s very simple to use & it doesn’t take long to charge.
customer_reviews.author: Chamuco

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I bought it for my husband's birthday and he loves it! It arrived sooner than stated and has been easy to use. My husband caught a 3lb 22in long catfish with this. Would recommend and have.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline H Hucks

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Present
customer_reviews.text: Just open as a Christmas present this morning and it took about 2 hrs to fully charge. Connection was very quick and easy on my Samsung S9+. I will update this review as soon as I can get this thing in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Guilford

customer_reviews.title: Great concept.
customer_reviews.text: Just received the ibobber, charged it and connected to an iPhone 7. Played around with the app and it seems like a great concept but I'm still a little skeptical. Guess I'll have to take it out to the water and see. One thing that drove me nuts for about 2 hours was the app said there's an update to firmware 2.0. I tried to upgrade it about 10 times and the device never took the upgrade. I even tried using my Galaxy S8 and it still didn't work. Hope it's not glitchy like this when I'm using it.
customer_reviews.author: Sei H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: If you like to kayak, this is a great depth / fish finder! Also, I live on a private lake and didn’t have a underwater map. This doesn’t map it for you, but it does give you the information you need to get to know the area. It also picks up the fish well. Unless you are ready to drop a lot more, this does the trick. Been using mine for 3 years now.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Larson

customer_reviews.title: ... was really hoping this was going to be a great fishing tool
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping this was going to be a great fishing tool. It is a great idea however it looses connectivity constantly when I recast or any slight ripple or waves in water. (sometimes just endlessly tries to sync and is in a waiting mode) Unfortunately I spent more time trying to sync my iPhone 6S Plus with the iBobber than actually fishing so it was more frustrating for me than useful. Just my 2 cents
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ritter

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: So far it works exactly as advertised ! Depth was correct, temperature was correct and bottom contour was correct. Very shortly it will be put to the actual fish finding test.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t stay connected
customer_reviews.text: Works, when connected. Constantly drops connection when in short range. Very disappointing for the price. First time out, I’ve spent more time trying to connect than fishing
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Danner

customer_reviews.title: It's all about the technology
customer_reviews.text: I expected this to be easier to read and understand it really doesn't give me accurate information I wish it could have it would tell me that there would be fishes beneath the area that on fishing up but there was not accurate reading was not accurate would not purchase it again Maybe if they had a more advanced product
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Mojena

customer_reviews.title: iBobber is fun and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This ibobber is a lot of fun and simple to use. I use it mainly as a scouting tool for murky waters, when I’m not in my fishing boat. Although I do like to walk out on the pier and cast it to the drop off to see where the fish currently are hanging out. (Check Fish Depth for that day). You’ll like this bobber if you want something quick and easy to use... if you’re looking for more details when fishing, get a fish finder with transducer .
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Adams

customer_reviews.title: True value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had my iBobber for over three years and I’ve used it from Portland Oregon to the East Coast here in Delaware. I love it. It does exactly what they said it will. I can find fish, I can map the bottom where I’m fishing, and even save my fishing experience. If you want something that’s easy and ready to use offshore or in a boat I highly suggest you pick one up.
customer_reviews.author: L. Davis

customer_reviews.title: The iBobber works just like it says.
customer_reviews.text: Took the iBobber to a pond for the first time, I casted it out and then threw bread into the water to feed the fish. I seen the fish come on the screen and then they started to feed . I think this is a great product to help locate schools of fish. And the depth feature was right on the money. I would recommend this product to any angler.
customer_reviews.author: Tonia Hebb

customer_reviews.title: useless
customer_reviews.text: Basically useless. Won't find fish, constantly disconnects from connection. It turns on simulation view when you think it's on regular view. Charging it is only done on the special cradle. Very unhappy with this device. I have tried it on numerous ponds and lakes and it always reads the same..... Nothing that will help me either find fish nor structure to fish near.
customer_reviews.author: CJC

customer_reviews.title: It works great and low cost too
customer_reviews.text: I like that the ibobber is compact and can fit in your pocket. It does the job I kayak fish a lot and it works fine for me. No worries about having to wire up a fish finder on my kayak and bring a battery all I have to do is reach in my pocket tie the ibobber to some fishing line and throw it out there. It’s really simple great for young anglers and people who are looking for an durable and affordable mobile fish finder.
customer_reviews.author: aaron herrera

customer_reviews.title: This is a good product. I use mine with 20lb braided line ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. I use mine with 20lb braided line attached to my surf rod. I can cast a long way and chart a lot of ground. The fish and structure that show up have led to an increase in fish caught and a better understanding of where and where not to throw my bait/lure.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: get back to you later worked pretty good so far fingers crossed
customer_reviews.text: Just got it going to check it out later today I gave it a 5 because set up was pretty easy Well checked out today and took to a little bass river in my area and it’s still to cold for them to be biting just yet but I bobber reall worked did every thing I expected water moves little to fast still but kept it close to boat as I floated down and it showed every thing it says will give a update later this month when bite get going but so far I think it is a cool too to use and makes it little more interesting
customer_reviews.author: hnter22878

customer_reviews.title: Cool but...
customer_reviews.text: Cool product, easy app to use, only drawback-I believe it has a hard time telling fish from weeds and needs to be used in deeper than 4 feet of water.
customer_reviews.author: Mblackman

customer_reviews.title: Had a rough start
customer_reviews.text: I was having problems with the iBobber immediately. Not matter what I did I kept getting a weak signal. However, I contacted ReelSonar's tech support. They asked me a couple questions and determined the device needed to be replaced...at no charge. I got the new device in a couple days and it works great! So, I recommend you test the device right away. If you have problems, contact ReelSonar and they will help you out.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buy!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m not good and fishing but son wants to go. Gave the iBobber a try and it got my boy excited to try different locations. Rather just casting anywhere, we walked around the lake until we found a good area with fishes. He caught his first fish there!!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it. Horrible device
customer_reviews.text: Horrible device. Bluetooth sucks,signal always lost even 5 ft away. Don't buy . Doesn't detect right stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Vadym

customer_reviews.title: Awesome device for the price
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic little device for the price. Impressed with its features and portability. Used it for the first time on a lake fishing from the shore. Showed me the depth, waterbed and where the fish were and how deep. While I didn’t catch anything I shared the information with the guy fishing next to me and he pulled in a nice sized trout within the next hour. Can’t wait to use this fishing from my kayak! Because of its weight, I found it easier to throw rather than cast with a lighter weight rod.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher Heidkamp

customer_reviews.title: Nice, fast to use tool!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty handy. I’ve use for both ocean and fresh water. On the ocean, I use it from my kayak and for fresh water, little fishing ponds. Just make sure you use strong braid on your pole when you’re throwing it out on the water as it is fairly heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight

customer_reviews.title: Great for Kayak fishing.
customer_reviews.text: This was super easy to use and it works great in my Kayak. I have been hunting for crappie spots in my lake for over a year. When I got my iBobber I found them easily. Love how it maps out the lake and gives me the water temperature. Very useful and I recommend for anyone for a great portable way to find your fish.
customer_reviews.author: James Meyer

customer_reviews.title: So far so Good.
customer_reviews.text: I can only give 4 stars due to not using this item as of yet...the water is currently frozen and will have to wait until spring to test this out since this was a Christmas gift. Item came just as described and the hubs was super excited to see this come his way! I hear good things about this item and hope it doesn't let us down! Lightweight. Looks like a real bobber. And seems easy to setup on iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoning

customer_reviews.title: ... 3 out of five times it would have a poor signal and I would wait for 3-5 minutes and ...
customer_reviews.text: The ibobber works but I have found that 3 out of five times it would have a poor signal and I would wait for 3-5 minutes and it wouldn't read in the water until I reeled it in and recast.I've tried this in 12 different lakes in 7 different cities in urban and rural areas. I'm not giving up yet and I'm hoping mine is simply defective and when I get the replacement it will work better
customer_reviews.author: Tdiesel27

customer_reviews.title: Useful but not a durable product.
customer_reviews.text: Used it twice on my backyard pond and it broke right off. Bare minimum drag. Additionay the bobber does not sit securely on the charger. It took multiple times to set it. Would have returned but the second use was outside the return window. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tariq Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Competively Priced
customer_reviews.text: Very competively priced and it does everything as advertised. It’s nice to know whether there are fish in the area you’re fishing and at what depth. Several times I couldn’t get it to activate but finally got it working by changing location thus I didn’t rate it 5-Stars.
customer_reviews.author: Clarence Turner

customer_reviews.title: Poor designed charger iBobber hasn’t worked for me yet
customer_reviews.text: Not very happy with iBobber. The charging base is poorly designed where cable goes into it. It bends and breaks too easily. The iBobber itself seems we’ll made and tough but doesn’t seem to work in our lake two lakes I have been trying to use it. It could be because the water is to muddy but I wouldn’t think it would be too muddy all the time. I hope to try it soon further out in lake from kayak later and away from shore. They do only charge $10.00 to replace charger base.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have a dedicated rod because your going to use this a lot
customer_reviews.text: Great little sonar works great. Now I don’t have to guess if there are fish out there I know they are out there.
customer_reviews.author: Marc F.

customer_reviews.title: ... use in the boundry waters snd i have really liked using it the battery lasts s long time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in the boundry waters snd i have really liked using it the battery lasts s long time. I made a leader for it to be towed behing the boat it seem to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon knox

customer_reviews.title: Not to bad
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice thing to have but it’s not all that accurate. The range isn’t that far. Still needs improvements but it’s a good start. If you don’t mind the short distance in range before the Bluetooth signal cuts off than this is not bad to have if you use it on a boat.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: A lot of features to fiddle around with
customer_reviews.text: For the money, it has a lot of features to play around with besides fishing, but working through my IPhone, it kept turning off to save the battery, which isn't much help when you are looking for fish and rowing a boat.
customer_reviews.author: Bergeek

customer_reviews.title: Really great bobber for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great bobber for the price and is well loved. Only issue is it has trouble with cloud cover. So won't really help unless clear skies. Otherwise amazing!
customer_reviews.author: confidential

customer_reviews.title: Don't believe the hype.
customer_reviews.text: Don't get your hope up for this product. The product doesn't work well as said. You loose bluetooth connection often with the device. You can't cast it far as they claim and receive the data (15 feet). Fish find is not consistent unless it is sitting on the water and drifting with the wind. Mapping is the only thing that had some range of accuracy. I give this product a thumbs down.
customer_reviews.author: francis

customer_reviews.title: Just ok.
customer_reviews.text: It DOES work but, I was only able to get anything on it more than about 40 feet away which is okay. It was also showing me multiple fish like maybe 12 or 13 over 15 inches and I've fished this pond long enough to know there's not that many in there that big. It's okay but I would not buy it again or reccomend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hancock

customer_reviews.title: Great deal easy to use
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use and way less money than a standard fish finder love it!
customer_reviews.author: Margarita bean

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is really cool for the price and you can use it anywhere. I use it with my iPhone 8 and it syncs up easily. The charging station is a little different but overall good product.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Jones

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable, does not last.
customer_reviews.text: Got mine about a year ago, tried it a few times through the ice, could never confirm whether or not I was seeing fish or the sensors we're confused and they definitely we're often confused, then the next time I pull it out it won't hold a charge, won't sync up and the app is going haywire. I'm not impressed, I know as fish finders go this is not expensive but $100 is $100.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Best little bobber.
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome little fish finder. Took it out ice fishing and it worked great! Can’t wait to try it in the summer at the lake!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Burns

customer_reviews.title: Was not a mistake to buy
customer_reviews.text: I was in shock to find out that this item was a thing. My idea of a good time is fishing and any tools to help my experience better is helpful. I found that this Bluetooth fish finder allowed me to locate where fishing would be. And the app you download comes with a little more information.
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio

customer_reviews.title: IF easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Not sure , will need to wait until fishing season
customer_reviews.author: THERESA HOUSTON

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal! Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: The Ibobber came on time and is so easy to set up. The app tutorial was easy to follow. So far so god! I’m taking it out on the lake tomorrow and will update this review after using it. UPDATE: Took my kayak out on the lake this morning and tried out the IBobber. It is awesome! It marked fish and I caught fish. Can’t beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: jamead1659

customer_reviews.title: Portable, cast able, and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Works really well! I use it on all my fishing trips. From shore fishing to ice fishing. It made such a huge difference in my fishing experience from going in blind to being able to cast it where ever I find a body of water and being able to see exactly what’s in there. It even works with my Apple Watch.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Most get
customer_reviews.text: Works grate wen you figure it out won’t take long but bring a battery pack Incase your going to keep it on
customer_reviews.author: mykey knows

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the kayak!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use for the most part. Just have to set the phone up so it doesn't turn off all the time. Gives me the bottom contour and shows me the depth and approximate numbers of fish.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky T Mathiasen

customer_reviews.title: Great portable fish finder for
customer_reviews.text: Did not have a chance to use until this summer. Great gadget for dedicated fisherman. It does what it says. Good at locating fish and first rate at mapping the waters contours and bottoms. The App is so easy to use and its a free download.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony N.

customer_reviews.title: I was hoping for the best, but after trying two units
customer_reviews.text: Dangit!!! I was hoping for the best, but after trying two units... gahhhhhhh! blue tooth synching is all but vague at best. On the rare occasions it did work...It indicated fish all over the place... but alas I surmise that it gets confused by sticks, rocks, and logs and shows them as fish. I emailed with the owner of company and he seemed befuddled as to why it wasn't working. Unfortunate... perhaps the next version will be better. Wishful thinking!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bass Chaser

customer_reviews.title: Nice to use
customer_reviews.text: I like the iBobber it is easily setup. The sonar could be better, but I use it to map structure mostly. I like the fact that it's super portable and can just be easily cast out.
customer_reviews.author: Paradoxious

customer_reviews.title: Time will yell if this is worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: The Ibobber is nice and seems to work OK. It is hard to attach as the hole is very small Have not seen fish turn color yet as per the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene M Schwarz

customer_reviews.title: Really nice to have while fishing
customer_reviews.text: It is a great device to have. It will help you. If your having trouble and your not sure if there is fish. This would be a perfect thing for you
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Aschbrenner

customer_reviews.title: Must have for a fisherman.
customer_reviews.text: An absolutely genius gadget. So far has performed as specified.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas G.

customer_reviews.title: Fun to Use
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bobber. Love the light feature for night fishing. Sometimes connectivity comes and goes which is the only downside. App was easy to install and use. Battery life is good. Fun to use.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor W

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Mapped out lake when I cast it out and reel it in just like it says, on accuracy part I would give 8/10. HOWEVER, the main issue with my iBobber is that I can not use the sonar part to locate fish. The iBobber constantly loses connection when it is not mapping. Once the iBobber gets more than 3ft away from my phone it says weak signal, once it is about 5ft I lose connection. How am I supposed to locate fish if the iBobber is 3ft away from me on a pier or on shore?
customer_reviews.author: Monico

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY THIS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ya don’t buy this product. Very bad. Not accurate at all. If it goes out of range it freezes. Randomly it will disconnect from your phone. I honestly wish I could get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Samual

customer_reviews.title: Total garbage
customer_reviews.text: I spend more time waiting for it to connect then fishing. In the end I had to return it. I do not purchase anything to return it, when I purchase something it's because I have or see a use for it. Hopefully they can fix the bugs so they I can purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: FancyNancy

customer_reviews.title: Simply a great tool for your tackle.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is GREAT. Simple activation and easy use of app. For the price and if you simply love to fish this I bobber is a must for your Arsenal. Add advantage to your skills. Tight lines my fellow anglers. Sean
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Works Great Close By...Beyond 20 Feet Not So Much..
customer_reviews.text: Echoing others...iBobber works great if you keep it close. Others say loses connection when cast 30 feet...mine more like 15-20. I wanted to map nearby pond from shore, but can’t keep connection. Doesn’t seem to measure depth accurately...spots I know are 20+ feet deep kept saying 8-10 feet. Fish-finding seems very good. Needed to update firmware, which it did easily. Overall, it feels 1-2 generations away from being outstanding...looking forward to iBobber 3.0.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good when it works
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product. Unfortunately connection is very sporadic. When I was hoping to use it the most, it would not connect from even 5 feet away. Just kept timing out.
customer_reviews.author: Claude B.

customer_reviews.title: Simple but works great.
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple fish finder and mapping device. It works well, a little slow on data transfer. I would buy again just for the easy of use from pond to pond.
customer_reviews.author: Windjammer28

customer_reviews.title: Work one day and never again.
customer_reviews.text: Well I wanted to love it, it connect easy the very first time I took it to the lake. But since then it won't ever connect again. Work great for one day. But never again.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I use it for bank fishing. After 3 or 4 casts I get a pretty accurate picture of the bottom features where I’m fishing.
customer_reviews.author: flyaway

customer_reviews.title: Connectivity a big issue
customer_reviews.text: I did a ton of research and almost all of these castable devices had a bunch of bad reviews but I wanted to try it so bad. Well, I spent most of the time trying to connect it to my phone and have it stay connected. I have a Samsung GS10. No matter what water depth or how far/close the device was to me and even if I was at a higher elevation than the device it never connected for more than 2 mins out of a 45 min attempt. I put it down and just fished.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Had it on the ice for a couple trips seems to work good except it keeps asking me the purchase date which I’ve put in multiple times but overall I’m liking it
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent.
customer_reviews.text: I got the ibobber about 1 year ago and it has been a great for me when I fish off a bank or on my lil inflatable boat. I never leave home with out it in my bag.
customer_reviews.author: skye alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Great product that works as described.
customer_reviews.text: Have used it about five times so far and seems to work perfect. Love the water temp feature. So far the longest I have had it out in the water is about five hours and was still going strong. No connection problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would have hoped that the product would have been in better condition (new) and all parts in the box
customer_reviews.text: We were excited to give the iBobber as a birthday gift to our son. However, when we opened the package, it was missing the carrying pouch as an included item and there were black smudges on the charger as if it had been used. The box was also damaged and there was not an instruction manual. For the price, I would have hoped that the product would have been in better condition (new) and all parts in the box. Disappointed to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: J Strong

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: I tried for three days to get this to work. including calling the manufacturer and downloading a patch. which made it worse by the way. Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Lanie

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Easy to charge, pair and set up. Worked well in my pool. I'll take it out on my kayak this weekend and update the review after that.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says. Great for lakes and streams.
customer_reviews.text: Great casting from shore it did a nice job of showing me the topography under the water and how many fish. This was a time saver for me if there were no fish I would move onto another spot not wasting time.
customer_reviews.author: buckeye

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: The fact that it does not work. I own a koi pond to test tge product I placed it in and 50 percent of the time it displayed the fish underneath it. Most of tge time the fish came near it the sonar did not recognize them. Took ut out into a large lake and tried again. Same thing no fish recognized but caught fish in that area.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For the money it’s good.
customer_reviews.text: Packaging is great, arrived in a timely manner. Learning curve is easy from the bank. I haven’t gotten to use it from my kayak yet so verdict is still out on that. The app is easy to use and easy to get to the setting you’re wanting to use. iPhone 7 battery life is my biggest complaint, I’ll be getting a battery case for that. Distance on Bluetooth has yet to be tested but at 35-40 feet it works fine. Overall for the money I’m happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t like to sync up g
customer_reviews.text: Cool idea, but it doesn’t like to sync up via Bluetooth very well. I read some reviews saying that Phone signal may be an issue but I had full 4G/LTE as well and it just wouldn’t connect.
customer_reviews.author: phillip chhem

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Received very quickly and in good condition. I haven’t been able to take it to the lake yet to test it, but it was very easy to set up with the app.
customer_reviews.author: Bret R

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to charge the bobber before going out fishing.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for two years. I fish in deep water, and could never catch the trout. Now I have over 40 this year alone by finding the fish first. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: The unit seemed to work the 1st day.. about 3 hours use..... Day 2 after about 1 hour, it decided to fail.. it started by telling us we were in 50 ft. of water (actually 15 ft.).. then it started saying "weak sonar signal" 10 ft. away... then it couldnt find it... deleted app and reinstalled.. found the unit but it would only give the water temp, and that bounced around in 5 degree increments... Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: John..

customer_reviews.title: It works ok . Good for a kid !
customer_reviews.text: It works I don't like the app interface . I think they could do better . At times it keeps disconnecting. I still use it's ok for the cheaper product out of the higher end stuff
customer_reviews.author: David W Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Really Dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: I took this out for the first time today. Bluetooth kept disconnecting at about 20 yards. A complete waste of money. I will be returning this and try a better brand.
customer_reviews.author: bruce davs

customer_reviews.title: Works but you need patience
customer_reviews.text: For what It is it’s a handy little tool it will show you fish that aren’t there or maybe they are but are not biting anything but if you watch it long enough then you can tell it’s reading objects as fish
customer_reviews.author: Drag mav

customer_reviews.title: Working as expected.
customer_reviews.text: So far performing as expected. Using currently when shore fishing. Looking forward to seeing performance when I go to Northern Wisconsin without out my boat. Renting a boat with no sonar.
customer_reviews.author: J C

product_meta.title: ReelSonar Wireless Bluetooth Smart Fish Finder
feature_bullets: Rechargeable battery and charge status indicator light
10+ hrs battery life.Syncs with iOS (Apple) 10.0 and later operating systems and Android 4.3 or later that use Bluetooth Smart (4.0)
Accurate sonar readings down to a depth of 135'
2 Snap swivel connections for use as bobber or as remote fish finder
Free app on iOS and Android
Bluetooth Smart sync up to a distance of 100' for best battery life on the market
Choose between raw sonar or fish tagging views
Depth-tagged fish icons color coded by size
GPS spot tagging with interactive map
Trip Log with date, time, location, water temp, conditions, type of fishing, lure, number and species of fish caught
Lunar calendar and weather (temp, rain, wind, barometer)
Trip and spot logging, weather, and lunar calendar app functions available w/o iBobber hardware
Compatible with Google Watch and iWatch
Refer to the manual below under the product description for more product use information, installation instructions and troubleshooting steps.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
